info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:40AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER CONTINUES STEADY RISE... The Salmon River has been rising since Sunday due to warm temperatures at elevation causing snow melt into the basin and a possible release from Summit Lake. The river is rising at about 1 foot every 12 hours and a crest is now most likely to occur on Friday. However, inherent uncertainty in these events result in varying crest height and timing issues. The area most at risk for impact is near 9 mile on the road along the Salmon River. Be aware of debris in the water. Very cold water will increase the threat of hypothermia. Please report any observed impacts to the National Weather Service in one of the following ways: From the website inws.ncep.noaa.gov/report, via social media by sending National Weather Service Juneau a message on Facebook or tweeting us @NWSJuneau, or email us at juneau.weather@noaa.gov.
